page.title: 05LANDSCAPE:CHESIL BEACH:FLEET
page.content: {CHESIL BEACH}IS THE MOST REMARKABLE AND DANGEROUS BEACH ON THE SOUTH{ {COAST.}THE WORD 'CHESIL' COMES FROM A SAXON WORD MEANING 'SHINGLE'.THE BEACH IS A LONG MOUNTAINOUS RIDGE OF PEBBLES EXTENDING FROM PORTLAND TO BRIDPORT-ABOUT 18 MILES.STARTING FROM THE{PORTLAND}END GOING DOWN TO{ {BRIDPORT}THE STONES START BIG AND GET SMALLER.IT IS PROBABLY THE LONGEST RIDGE IN{EUROPE.}THE AVERAGE HEIGHT OF THE BEACH IS 55 FEET ABOVE{SEA} LEVEL.THE SHARP DIG OF THE BEACH AND THE TERRIBLE UNDERTOW MAKE BATHING EXTREMELY DANGEROUS.AS THE WATER IS VERY COLD.THE TIDE DOES NOT FLOW IN AND OUT BUT EBBS AND FLOWS UP AND DOWN THE BEACH FROM{PORTLAND TO BRIDPORT {AND BRIDPORT TO PORTLAND}.
